name: Green Valley Ranch Resort and Spa

reviews.text: Room was excellent: spacious and it was very clean. Front desk very helpful.
reviews.title: Nice place to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the people at the coffeeshops are very slow and there were only 2 girls for 20 people who wanted coffee.
reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable resort

reviews.text: There are nice restaurants and shops in the neighbourhood.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place to Vacation!

reviews.text: We stayed here while visiting relatives in Henderson. We had a spotlessly clean, very well appointed room with a comfortable bed and a nice big tub in the bathroom. Excellent customer service from beginning to end, and a great "off the strip" price. The casino was very nice, with several good restaurants and bars. The best thing was that we didn't have to walk through the casino to get to our room from the hotel entranced or from the pool. The casino is attached, but in a separate area from the guestroom area of the hotel. Only fatal flaw was the very, very loud raucous pool scene. No way to relax and enjoy a quiet swim and sunbathe, as the ambient music is at ear splitting rock concert level throughout the entire pool area. It's all about the twenty-something heavy drinking party crowd here, so kids and older folks may not be comfortable. I took one look and went right back to my room. I later discovered that as a hotel guest, I could use the pool for free at the attached health spa, which was quieter and much more private. I would definitely stay there again, it's a top notch hotel just outside of Vegas proper.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: After a sudden death in my family, I had many people arriving here in Henderson looking for a place to stay.
reviews.title: Need maintenance

reviews.text: Recent business trip to Vegas took me out to Henderson. Rather than travel back and forth to hotels on the strip I decided to check out GVRR. What a really nice place. The hotel is fantastic. The rooms are gorgeous. The bathroom is the size of my first NYC apartment. The pool and spa area was tremendous. The grounds are well maintained and very clean. The casino is big enough to have whatever you need. I would definitely recommend this place if you are tired of the strip and want a few night get-away. I would say this is perfect for the parent-getaway weekend. Quiet enough to be peaceful but close enough to the strip for a bit of wrong-ness, if so you so choose. Strip was probably a 20 minute ride.
reviews.title: Awesome place if you want to stay off the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at GVR many times but I have noticed that the resort is cutting back on things.
reviews.title: Not as nice as it once was

reviews.text: #1 No coffee in the room! That is just wrong, you even took the coffee away from the lobby, now you have to go to the cafe or coffee bean or out to the district for a cup.
reviews.title: Bring back the coffee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: #2 We always rent cabanas and you stopped serving pastries, now it's just fruit and some chips.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: #3 Slots, wow when did you guys tighten them up to where you can blow through $100 in about 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, off strip

reviews.text: Bert Cirincione runs the best race & sports book in Las Vegas. The race book is comfortable and set up perfectly for race playing and sports betting. The GVR team are professionals that really cater to the race/sports fans. This is one of the only places in Las Vegas where you feel respected as a horseplayer. Bert pays personal attention to all patrons and always remembers you. We hadn't seen Bert for almost a year and he took good care of our crew during the Derby. The GVR is a beautiful and relaxing hotel casino - first class. The restaurants are also outstanding. The GVR gets a big thumbs up!
reviews.title: The best race & sports book in Las Vegas!

reviews.text: It's a pretty nicely maintained hotel, although it could do with an update. I had requested a nonsmoking room with queen beds, but apparently the fine print on the website contains some weasel words that they can assign you whatever room they feel like on the day that you arrive. So upon arrival I was given the choice between a smoking room or pay a lot extra for a king suite with a rollaway single bed. So rather than spending the night in comfort I ended up paying a bunch of extra money for the honor to sleep in a rollaway single bed with inferior linens covered in hair. Vegas has a reputation for sleaze, but this place goes a step beyond that.
reviews.title: Smokers' paradise, but strip is better overall

reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had a horrible experience. I actually chipped a tooth while eating breakfast at the Grand Cafe. I even had a colleague who heard the crunch of my tooth. I thought that it would be a simple resolution and they would take responsibility and help with the dental bills. Was I wrong. They sent me through their insurance adjusters who 3 months later denied any responsibility for the claim, even with the eye witness report. I was very disappointed with their service and processes. So be careful.
reviews.title: Chipped tooth; No responsibility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is wonderful, beautiful, and accomodating. Would rate it excellant but for a few small things. No coffee pot in room or in the lobby; some communication errors within the staff: front desk could not tell us how to work the safe in the room; need passes to get on their shuttle to the strip; again not passed on to us. Other than that, it's a great place to stay. Not far from the strip but quiet and easy to get there. Would definitely stay there if we ever went back.
reviews.title: Green Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to the Green Valley Resort and Spa because of their spa. It's a double edged sword giving up our secrets here, but we enjoy the spa pool, massage selection, fitness center, and the overall quietness of an otherwise loud Las Vegas. The staff at the hotel was very responsive to our needs our requests. Navigating their reservation systems was a bit frustrating, but once we got there we were able to fix the problem. We book a cheap room, then requested the $75 upgrade for a ground level room with patio. Sweet! Spacious rooms too!
reviews.title: Return Trip to the Green Valley Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a long weekend, and chose this hotel to be closer to family in the area. We come back to the Las Vegas area 3-4 times a year, and I was hopeful this would be our new "spot". Um, not so much. The room was comfortable, with a decent view of the pool, but was dusty, with hair on the pillows. The magazines were a month+ out of date. There was a huge party on the deck below our room our last night, and it was impossible to get anyone to answer the phones to let us know how long we could expect the extreme noise to go on (the music was louder than the "nightclub" downstairs we had just left). The Concierge leaves by 5:00 pm, so good luck getting reservations for ANYTHING (the front desk refuses to help or offer any suggestions - tells you to come back tomorrow). The Grand Cafe was a complete debacle, which we just avoided altogether after 2 attempts (the staff couldn't be any ruder there). The Cabanas and staff were great, but the general pool/bar staff...not so awesome. The bikini's the girls wear were 4 sizes too small, and honestly, I don't want to know what my server's butt-crack looks like, nor the fact she hasn't seen a razor in at least 3 weeks. It was disgusting. I get that Vegas is about skimpy outfits and all, and I'm ok with that, but this was clearly a group who just didn't care about what they looked like, and who saw what. I think the place has potential, but it really feels like they've all just given up and have chosen to cater to the locals who are using the pools and restaurants - visitors be damned.
reviews.title: Ok, but lacking...felt like they may be in financial trouble

reviews.text: Such an amazing hotel !!!!! with three separate pools, a spa and gym located next to the pools , has plush flowers and palm trees ,lots of restaurants. And very nice staff I wouldn't stay anywhere else cant wait to return for my next stay
reviews.title: Off strip but a five minute drive to the strip
Horrible customer service
reviews.text: We booked three nights sat-mon and when we arrived, the hotel claimed they had NO reservation with our name. (I had called the previous night to confirm and they had all our information). We decided to go back to GVR to try our reservations again about an hour later, and magically they found it! They didn't have a room available until 5pm that night. Stuck with baggage and no where to go for hours. They had overbooked the hotel and didn't have any place for us, even though we made a reservation. Bad customer service!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room at Green Valley Ranch for out latest trip to Las Vegas. Had never stayed here before, but we chose it because it was close to our son and daughter-in-law's house in Henderson. Boy, are we glad that we did!
reviews.title: Awesome stay..Don't miss it!

reviews.text: This place is beautiful and truly first rate. The rooms are gorgeous and the amenities stack up with any hotel I have ever stayed in. The pool and spa area are to die for. The staff was helpful and attentive. The restaurants are good and the casino is a good place to gamble. Although it is in Henderson, it is right off the 215 and is only 8-10 mins from the Strip by car. It is a happening place, but without the hustle and craziness of the Strip. We were not traveling with any, but I think this would be a great place to stay if you were traveling with children.
reviews.title: First groupon trip

description: Green Valley Ranch Resort is unquestionably one of the finest Las Vegas casino resort hotels, equally exquisite both inside and out. Attending to guests with impeccable service, wealth of outstanding amenities, and expansive pools and gardens, Green Valley Ranch has become renowned as one of the top luxury resort hotels in Henderson, Las Vegas ... in the USA. Green Valley Ranch Resort has all that you require from Exquisite Accommodations, the ultimate in relaxation and rejuvenation at The Spa, Award-Winning Dining, Non-Stop Gaming Action, Entertainment for Everyone, Meeting & Events, to our The Backyard with incredible scenery, sand-bottom pool and laid-back vibe, not to mention a great selection of drinks.
